description: From Latin pāgānismus (“heathenism”), from pāgānus (“peasant, rural, rustic”). The term was used pejoratively by early Muslims and Christians to belittle what remained of the native religions. Synchronically, pagan +‎ -ism.

examples: Most people in that region practise their own form of paganism.

entries.meaning: Any of a class of religions often associated with nature rituals.
examples: Various neopagan movements have arisen, each advancing its own form of paganism. Some are monotheist.
